title: Security remediation plan (Q1 2026)
description: Execute findings from docs/security-audit.md: dependency upgrades, browser hardening, and tool-origin isolation.

title: Upgrade Astro to patched release and clear advisories
description: Upgrade Astro from 4.x to latest patched 5.x, update lockfile, run build/preview, and verify npm audit high/moderate advisories are resolved.
acceptance_criteria: astro >= 5.17.2; npm run build passes; npm audit --omit=dev has no high vulnerabilities.

title: Add CSP and deployment security headers
description: Define CSP, Referrer-Policy, Permissions-Policy, HSTS, and X-Content-Type-Options at deployment edge for hntbo origin.
acceptance_criteria: Required headers are present in production/staging responses and documented in repo deployment config.

title: Isolate high-privilege browser tools to dedicated origin
description: Plan and implement dedicated subdomain/origin for tools that use File System Access API (e.g., FolderManager), separating from marketing pages.
acceptance_criteria: Tools served from dedicated origin with stricter CSP and documented DNS/routing/deploy changes.

title: Harden destructive tool UX and least-privilege access
description: Reduce write scope where possible, enforce clear destructive confirmations, and document permission model for FolderManager.
acceptance_criteria: Destructive actions require explicit confirmation and non-destructive flows use read-only access where feasible.

title: Add security checks to CI pipeline
description: Add CI steps for npm audit and security header validation for deployed URLs.
acceptance_criteria: CI fails on high vulnerabilities or missing required headers.
